name: places/ChIJSRriEhv0wokRwC6CL8TkOxQ
formattedAddress: 492 Audubon Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA
adrFormatAddress: 492 Audubon Ave, New York, NY 10040, USA

originalText.text: If i could truly give this business a negative 5 star review, i would in a heart beat. I took my maid of honor gown for my sisters wedding to this cleaner back in December with the fear that I myself would ruin the dress if i attempted to Iron it for the big day. We came to pick it up the night before the wedding and hung it up in a safe place once we arrived to jersey. The morning of the wedding, I open the gown and am HORRIFIED to see my dress had been completely ruined. The material of the dress looked like it was scrapped on concrete or something. As if too much heat was applied for too long. I immediately called them and they assured me they would do what ever it took to rectify the situation. Once I got into the city the literal first thing I did was go to the store and bring the dress with me. I was hit with backlash and was told that I must have been the one to ruin the dress because it was not like this when given to me (i literally took the dress out of its PLASTIC to put it on). After going back and fourth for a few days they finally told me to leave the dress at the store and they would do what ever they could to fix the dress but to give them time because the “season was busy”. I received my dress yesterday and almost died. They had completely replaced the front material with a cheaper not even the same color material and completely destroyed the style of the dress. Unfortunately this is going to be in my memory forever because I had to wear this dress to my ONLY sisters wedding. Disappointed is an understatement. Ive been told they would speak to the owner for a partial refund but have yet to be contacted. I hope this is able to help anyone else out there looking to bring their clothes somewhere. This was truly a nightmare and unfortunately will never be forgotten due to the occasion. Oh and to add a cherry on top of the Sunday they were also extremely racist to my boyfriend who is Asian. Truly horrible business. The senior women that work there are the absolute worst. I put before and after fotos of the dress before it met their hands and after.

originalText.text: Dropped off some pants to get hemmed. He didn't get anything right.....they told me to bring them back and they will fix them. I took them back but after I did I resented it and went to get them back as I wanted to cut my losses before he messes them up completely.  That's when the tailor didn't wanna give me my pants back he said he wanted to fix them mandatory. I told him it's ok I'll go to where I normally go . I told him he can keep the money and I just wanted to take my pants and leave and he still didn't wanna give me my pants.. after 10 minutes of yelling at him and the owner I was able to get my property back. She was willing to give me my money back but I refused.. it's about the principle..   the guy claimed he sewed for Gucci bout 5 times..but couldn't sew a straight hem.. Smh

originalText.text: Great services, fast, and best price in town.
